mainDetails.name: Event
mainDetails.value: Sound-Space Audio Lab Overture Center Event Series

mainDetails.name: Venue
mainDetails.value: The Overture Center for the Arts, Promenade Hall

mainDetails.name: About
mainDetails.value: A concert of immersive fixed media works including Edgard Varèse's seminal composition Poème Électronique, written for Le Corbusiers's Philips Pavilion at the 1958 Brussels World Fair, and recent works by Nathaniel Bartlett, created during time (2014-2017) in the high desert of Northern New Mexico (USA)

mainDetails.name: More Info
mainDetails.value: Free, donations encouraged, reservations encouraged (capacity 100)

mainDetails.name: Event Series
mainDetails.value: ToBeContinued...2017

mainDetails.name: Venue
mainDetails.value: Stazione di Topolò, multiple live listening posts across the globe, and live internet stream

mainDetails.name: More Info
mainDetails.value: ToBeContinued...2017 is a concert lasting 24 hours, from 00.00 hours to the midnight of March 24th, GMT+1, during which musicians from many parts of the world will be connected to a website that will broadcast their concerts. During this uninterrupted 24 hour marathon, each musician -- representing a range of new music practices -- will have a 30 minute window for live or prerecorded performance created especially for this event

mainDetails.name: More Info
mainDetails.value: This event is an open house. Stop by anytime 11:00am - 05:00pm. Playback of the new work on the hour (45min duration), every hour. Socialize / talk  00:45 - 00:60. Meet me, see/hear my mobile 3D high-def electroacoustic rig, learn about my work, and my other upcoming ABQ/SF events. Free (donations welcome)
